page.title: 13HISTORIC BUILDINGS
page.content: The present owner of Low Middleton Hall is Miss.Duff. Low Middleton Hall is a very interesting place to look at. It was built in 1721 by the Killinghall family and the front part of the house added in the 19th century. It is now a large house made from 2 inch Dutch bricks,pantile roof and lots of windows. On an original wall at the back of the house is an interesting mark-it is an insurance sign. It means that if you had a fire, a man came,checked to see if you had their sign,and would then send his fire brigade. There is a walled garden with out buildings which used to be the servants quarters,stables for horses and a water pump which still pumps water electrically from their own well.At the end of the garden there was a Ha-ha,a deep ditch which kept the cattle out of one's garden.
